Posts.Content: I’ve got this too.. started after RT my nurse says it’s normal and nothing to worry over.  Good luck
Posts.Title: **MAY 2019 BREAST CANCER RADIOTHERAPY CHAT**

Posts.Content: Hi all I was diagnosed with breast cancer in November 2018 I had op and tumour was removed, also had two lymph nodes removed.  Oncoligist said I was lucky as they managed to get it all away in op. However he referred me for 15 preventative radiotherapy sessions, I had my last one 10th feb 2019. He also prescribed Tamoxifen, which brings its own wee set of problems, but manageable. Icouldnt look at my wounds at first, it was very difficult for me but breast nurse advised me to get to know my new shape boob. This is making me paranoid as I can feel a hard large lump in area where tumour was, also got a wee crust on nipple. Is this normal.? or do I need to see someone about this? .
Posts.Title: What normal

Posts.Content: Just to update I’ve now been checked out. Thankfully the lumps I’m feeling are fluid pockets. Such a relief. But I’m glad I got them checked out .
Posts.Title: What normal

Posts.Content: I’ve started massage and it’s helping heaps. Thank you . hopefully it’s just scar tissue  M x
Posts.Title: What normal

Posts.Content: Thank you moomy I’ll do that and I’ve arranged to see BN in two weeks
Posts.Title: What normal

Posts.Content: Thank you so much Happyfeet, you have made me feel so much better. Great you have taken the time to write that lovely and comforting reply.ill see BN on 16th and keep you posted on outcome of that.  M xx
